The key idea is that if sample space is appropriately defined, this approach is equivalent to adding up all models interactions in Eq. ( 7). We stress that this also considers all model interactions of up to order n (Eq. ( 4)). As we will show later, this approach is tractable, and can be implemented with relative ease using MCMC
25, 26 . MCMC is a method to sample from a joint distribution of parameters using Markov chains. The chain of the prediction variable A provides a way to estimate its probability density. The fraction of samples within an intersection of regions associated with any hypothesis combination naturally provides a tractable way to calculate the probability for that combination.
